problem_text:
Can the braid group Bn for n ⩾4 be embedded into the automorphism group Aut(Fn−2) of a free group Fn−2 of rank n −2?
Artin’s theorem implies that Bn can be embedded into Aut(Fn), and an embedding of Bn, n ⩾3, into Aut(Fn−1) was constructed in (B. Perron, J. P. Vannier, Math. Ann., 306 (1996), 231–245).
V. G. Bardakov
answer: No, it cannot for n = 4 (V. G. Bardakov, P. Bellingeri, in Knot theory and its applications. ICTS program knot theory and its applications (KTH-2013), IISER Mohali, India, December 10–20, 2013, Amer. Math. Soc., Contemporary Mathematics, 670 (2016), 285–298).
